revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Dan Bakkedahl | image = Bakkedahl.JPG | imagesize = 250px | caption = Bakkedahl with his wife, Irene, at the 2008 Emmy Awards | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|11|18}} | birth_place = [[Rochester, Minnesota]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = Actor/Comedian | yearsactive = 2005–present | spouse = Irene Bakkedahl
(2003–present) | children = 2 }} '''Dan Bakkedahl''' (born November 18, 1969) is an [[United States|American]] actor and improvisational comedian from [[Chicago]]'s [[The Second City|Second City]]. He is best known for starring as Tim Hughes on the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Life in Pieces]]'', as Congressman Roger Furlong on the [[HBO]] series ''[[Veep (TV series)|Veep]]'', and as Steve Nugent in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[Legit (2013 TV series)|Legit]]''. From 2005 to 2007, he was a correspondent for three seasons on ''[[The Daily Show with Jon Stewart]]''. ==Life and career== Bakkedahl was born in [[Rochester, Minnesota]], and was raised in [[Stuart, Florida]]. He is a 1988{{fact|date=June 2018}} graduate of Martin County High School. He is of part Norwegian descent.[https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/tallahassee/doc/442332106.html 'Daily Show' dude got serious about acting at FSU]. Bakkedahl attended [[St. Cloud State University]] in Minnesota, before completing his studies at [[Florida State University]], where he was a member of the [[Chi Phi]] Fraternity. After college, Bakkedahl toured for a year with the Repertory Theater of America. After moving to Chicago, he made a name for himself at the [[Improv Olympic]] performing in the influential two-man improv show ZUMPF with his teacher [[Miles Stroth]]. Dan went on to perform at the [[The Second City|Second City]] mainstage, eventually writing ''Doors Open on the Right'', [[The Second City|Second City]]’s 90th [[revue]]. In [[Chicago]], he is often noted for having left the Second City mainstage due to artistic differences.{{cite web|last =Lara|first =Roland|title =Chicago Smart-Ass Makes Good|publisher =chicagoist.com|url =http://chicagoist.com/2005/09/20/chicago_smartass_makes_good.php|accessdate =2008-07-09|deadurl =yes|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20091104141500/http://chicagoist.com/2005/09/20/chicago_smartass_makes_good.php|archivedate =2009-11-04|df =}} Bakkedahl continues to perform regularly at comedy venues such as the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]], [[Magnet Theater]], [[The Second City|Second City]] and [[The Improv|Improv]] Comedy Lab in Los Angeles. He is also a member of the advisory council of the California Shakespeare Theater.[http://www.calshakes.org/ California Shakespeare Theater] Bakkedahl's first major television work was on Comedy Central's ''[[The Daily Show]]'' where he served as a correspondent from 2005 to 2007. After leaving ''The Daily Show'' in 2007, he has since moved to [[Los Angeles]] and went on to have supporting roles in the films such as ''[[Observe and Report]]'', ''[[The Heat (film)|The Heat]]'', and ''[[This Is 40]]''. He also appeared in the ''Snake 'N Bacon'' animated special on [[Adult Swim]], which aired on May 10, 2009. In early 2010, he co-starred in the comedy pilot ''Our Show'' on [[NBC]]. From 2010 through 2011, Bakkedahl appeared in a series of commercials for [[T-Mobile]] cellular phones, where he plays a human likeness of [[AT&T]]'s 3G network. Bakkedahl has made guest appearances on shows such as ''[[30 Rock]]'', ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'', ''[[Newsreaders]]'', and ''[[The United States of Tara]]'', as well as appearing in recurring roles as "Murray the A/C Repairman" in season three of ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'' and currently as Congressman Furlong on ''[[Veep (TV series)|Veep]]''. In 2015, he began recurring roles ''[[The Goldbergs (2013 TV series)|The Goldbergs]]'' as science teacher Mr. Woodburn and on ''[[The Mindy Project]]'' as Dr. Adrian Bergdahl. Bakkedahl starred alongside [[Jim Jefferies (comedian)|Jim Jeffries]] and [[DJ Qualls]] in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[Legit (2013 TV series)|Legit]]'', which ran for two seasons on [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] and [[FXX]]. Bakkedahl currently stars as Tim Hughes on the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Life in Pieces]]'', which began airing in 2015. The show will begin its fourth season in fall 2018. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%" |- style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" |Year
